data.text:

Instead of using Gimp, use Paint.net to export the image with transparent background. Althought the Gimp exported files are interpreted as transparent in all other software (IrfanView, Internet Browsers, etc.), the Pinnacle Studio accepts only those from Paint.net. I can not explain this, but may be I save you 4 hours of investigating :)

I updated the drivers because the ones from the vendor, MSI, didn't work with hardware acceleration in Pinnacle Studio either, so I thought I would give the latest drivers a go, particularly the studio driver from NVidia rather than the gaming driver which was supplied.

2- Provide detailed step-by-step replication instructions to try to test this in our lab and if possible some screenshots or a short video showing the behavior. Could you please also share with us a project sample for testing?

1. I have not tested with another version of Pinnacle because later versions do not support Dolby Digital 5.1 audio import and export. Studio 18 Ultimate does, so until later versions do I will stay with 18.

We do understand your point that "Pinnacle Studio 24 does not support Dolby Digital 5.1 audio import and export" and we were aware of this when reviewing the videos. However, since we are not able to get Pinnacle* Studio 2018 from the official source*, and we even contacted them and they said "Pinnacle* Studio 18 is legacy and they no longer distribute it nor support it", our recommendation is to check this further with Corel* support for more details regarding this behavior and support options.

Pinnacle Studio is a video editing program originally developed by Pinnacle Systems as consumer-level software. Upon Pinnacle System's acquisition of Munich-based FAST Multimedia,[1] Pinnacle integrated the professional code base of FAST's editing software, (since re-branded as Pinnacle Liquid) beginning with Pinnacle Studio version 10. It was acquired by Avid and later by Corel in July 2012.[2] Pinnacle Studio allows users to author video content in Video CD, DVD-Video, AVCHD or Blu-ray format, add complementary menus and burn them to disc.

Open Broadcaster Software (OBS) Studio and Pinnacle Studio are two powerful tools, highly favored by artists and video creators around the world. They can be used together in your video production projects to record, process, edit, and broadcast your content online. Both products provide you with highly innovative features for optimum control over the quality of the output. In this blog post, we will analyze how you can create immersive videos using these tools and stream them on your favorite video streaming platform, for example, YouTube and Facebook.

To edit the recorded video with the MP4 file type, choose the "H264" and "AAC" codecs and change the value of the Keyframe Interval to 1.If you change "Keyframe Interval" from "150" to "1," all frames will become keyframes, allowing you to edit a video more precisely.

Note 1: If the Keyframe Interval is set to 1, the file size will increase.Note 2: If Bandicam is set to 30 FPS, 30 frames will be created per second (60 frames per 2 seconds, 90 frames per 3 seconds, 120 frames per 4 seconds, 150 frames per 5 seconds, etc.). If the Keyframe Interval is set to 150, one keyframe will be created every 5 seconds (= 150 frames).

It comes with clever masking tools that allow you to choose an object and refine the selection with great precision. The tracking option is done automatically for you but can take some time, and you also have tools to refine and repair said tracking afterwards should you need to.

Speaking of masks, those tools have been refined, making it even easier to select objects, using raster and vector shapes to perfect your masks. Using a mask to track an object as mentioned above is such a clever idea. We had fun experimenting with that feature.

Pinnacle Studio comes in three flavors, Studio, Studio Plus, and Studio Ultimate. All allow you to work in 8K, but the first two have certain limitations. We tested the Ultimate version. Unfortunately, there's no free version - but if you're working to a budget, we've tested the best free video editing software. Nor will on-the-go users find this one of the best video editing apps, with no apps available for making mobile edits. But that's expected with a pro-level, desktop-based suite like this. This is serious stuff.

Studio Plus ups the ante with 24 tracks, the ability to work with 4 cameras in multi-camera mode, you can access basic motion tracking tools, blend mode, the advanced audio editor, and batch processing. 589ccfa754
